The language used seems professional, and there are various international phone numbers and authors mentioned, which could lend credibility. They also mention partnerships with government and leading organizations. However, there are a few high-priced items, such as certifications and eLearning courses, which could potentially be a scam if the certifications are not legitimate. thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain apmg-international.com is registered and has been since 2007. The expiration date is in 2025, and the registrar is Tucows, a reputable registrar. The domain status is clientTransferProhibited and clientUpdateProhibited, which are normal security measures. The contact details are redacted for privacy, which is common under GDPR regulations. The presence of a long-standing domain with a future expiration date suggests that the site could be legitimate. However, I still need to verify the credibility of the business and ensure that the products and certifications they offer are recognized.
observation: [{'url': 'https://www.glassdoor.com.au/Reviews/APMG-International-Reviews-E764798.htm', 'content': 'Glassdoor has 14 APMG-International reviews submitted anonymously by APMG-International employees. Read employee reviews and ratings on Glassdoor to decide if APMG-International is right for you. Glassdoor'}, {'url': 'https://www.trustpilot.com/review/apmg-international.com', 'content': 'Terrible experience. Declined my test booking 90 minutes before with no apology. - I requested an exam slot on Thursday when my course ended for 7am Monday morning (the only slots available for the entire week after my course were at 6am & 7am) - made special arrangements to have a place to take the test.'}, {'url': 'https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/APMG-International-Reviews-E764798.htm', 'content': 'Respect comes from the CEO and flows through HR and the teams. Friendly, family feel and a good work life balance. Working from home embraced and consistently long working hours discouraged. Benefits are good. The company is small enough that an individual can make a difference. Cons.'}, {'url': 'https://www.glassdoor.co.in/Reviews/APMG-International-Reviews-E764798.htm', 'content': '14 APMG-International reviews. A free inside look at company reviews and salaries posted anonymously by employees.'}, {'url': 'https://www.glassdoor.com/Overview/Working-at-APMG-International-EI_IE764798.11,29.htm', 'content': 'APMG-International Reviews APMG-International 14. 4.2. 74 % Recommend to a Friend. 5.0. Was a great company. Sales. Current Employee. Boston, MA. Recommend. CEO Approval. Business Outlook. Pros. Great team to work with in the US office before leadership changed. Cons. Leadership changed and it changed the company.'}]

thought: The search results from Glassdoor and Trustpilot show mixed reviews about APMG International. Some reviews mention a poor experience with the exam booking process, while others highlight a positive work environment within the company. Since these reviews are mainly about the company's internal culture and exam booking process, they don't necessarily confirm the legitimacy of the certifications offered. However, the presence of reviews on these sites does suggest that APMG International operates as an active entity in the professional certification space. I need more information to conclude if the certifications are recognized and if the site operates as a legitimate business in the professional certification industry.

thought: The search results indicate that APMG International is involved in offering certifications and has a page dedicated to accreditation, suggesting that the certifications they offer are meant to be recognized in the professional sphere. They claim to collaborate closely with government and industry leaders and mention that their certification schemes are used by a significant portion of top global companies. This information suggests a level of recognition and legitimacy in the certifications offered by APMG International. Given the long-standing registration of the domain, the presence of customer reviews, and the information suggesting recognition of the certifications offered, there is no significant evidence that APMG International is operating a scam website. They appear to be a legitimate provider of professional certifications. I now know the final answer. The URL https://store.apmg-international.com/ does not appear to be a scam website.

observation.reason: The website has been registered for a long time and offers certifications that claim recognition in the professional sphere. No evidence of typical scam characteristics such as unusually low prices money claims targeting of weaknesses non-existent companies inappropriate contact details ambiguous privacy policies unusual payment methods or outdated information was found.
